results.title: Don Pasquale
results.creator_credit: HTV Cymru Wales, Terry deLacey and Basil Coleman
results.brief_description: This made for television production of the comic opera “Don Pasquale” by Gaettano Donizetti features The Welsh Philharmonia led by John Stein and conducted by Richard Armstrong and The Welsh National Opera Chorale led by associate conductor Anthony Hose with music direction by Norman Kay. It tells the tale of Don Pasquale (Geraint Evans), an elderly and wealthy bachelor who is desperate to marry, whilst however, his nephew and sole heir, Ernesto (Ryland Davies), refuses to marry the woman assigned to him by Pasquale because Ernesto is in love with another woman, Norina (Lillian Watson). As a result, Pasquale disowns Ernesto. With the help of Ernesto’s friend, Dottora Malatesta (Russell Smythe), an elaborate scheme is prepared in which Norina marries Don Pasquale and drives him so crazy as to allow her to marry Ernesto instead. Delightful costuming and set designs in beautiful pastel colors along with the magical voices of the lead singers, make this entertaining and light-hearted production a must for lovers of opera. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Don Juan de Marco
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Francis Ford Coppola, Fred Fuchs, Patrick Palmer and Jeremy Leven
results.brief_description: Just ten days shy of his retirement, psychotherapist Jack Mickler (Marlon Brando) is brought in by the authorities to help ‘talk down’ a suicidal man (Johnny Depp), devastated by the loss of his lover. Clothed in a cape and mask the heart broken man believes he is the legendary seducer of women, Don Juan De Marco. The doctor takes him on as a patient and through their therapy sessions Don Juan recounts his many romantic adventures and conquests. At first sceptical of the mans sanity, Dr. Mickler is gradually seduced by Don Juan’s outlandish tales of love, leading him to question the fictional nature of his stories and the man’s real identity. It’s not long before Mickler is applying Don Juan’s instructional lessons on his wife (Faye Dunaway). Jeremy Leven’s unashamed paean to romance is given unexpected depth and poignancy from the exceptional cast, starting with the ever charismatic Johnny Depp and the inspired coupling of Marlon Brando and Faye Dunaway. Their intimate husband and wife banter is one of the films highlights. Cast also includes Geraldine Pailhas, Bob Dishy, Rachel Ticotin, Talisa Soto and Selena Perez.

results.title: Don Juan = Don Juan 1973 ou Si Don Juan Etait Une Femme
results.brief_description: Roger Vadim directed Brigitte Bardot in her last feature film, as a female version of the legendary lover, Don Juan. Told in flashback, the narrative depicts Jeanne’s confession — to seducing an array of vulnerable men, several of whom meet with sticky ends. Partly a critique of sexual mores, this film plays as an intriguing timepiece of female sexuality and the corruptive urges of human nature. Cast also includes Jane Birkin as one of Jeanne’s lovers.

results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia) and Peter Butler
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian with English subtitles, this opera combines comedy and tragedy to produce the story of Don Giovanni. The central character of Giovanni is the anti-hero, a brilliant, irresponsible villain, an amourous libertine who receives his comeupances by refusing to repent. Performers on the tape include Lisa Gasteen, Gilli Sullivan, Fiona Janes and David Hobson. The performance was part of an Esso night at the opera,recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, January 1991 and was directed by Lindy Hume. Featuring the Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra, conducted by Gyorgy Fischer, this performance was based on the production by Goran Jarvefelt.

results.title: Don Giovanni
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne Festival Opera, along with the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Bernard haitink and the Glyndebourne Chorus directed by Nicholas Cleobury, presents Don Giovanni by W.A. Mozart with libretto by Lorenzo Da Ponte. This original production is by Sir Peter Hall, Director of the National Theatre, and features Benjamin Luxon in the lead role of Don Giovanni, Stafford Dean (Leporello), Rachel Yakar (Donna Elvira), Horiana Branisteanu (Donna Anna), Leo Goeke (Don Ottavio), Elizabeth Gale (Zerlina), John Rawnsley (Masetto) and Pierre Thau (Commendatore). Sung in Italian with English subtitles. Includes program notes.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: Metropolitan Opera (New York, N.Y.), Clemente D'Alessio and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This wonderful and lavish production of Don Carlo by Giuseppe Verdi was recorded live at the Metropolitan Opera on 26 March 1983 and performed by an extraordinary cast including Placido Domingo in the role of Don Carlo, with Mirella Freni (Elizabeth of Valois), Grace Bumbry (The Princess Eboli), Louis Quilico (Rodrigo), Nicolai Ghiaurov (King Philip) and Ferruccio Furlanetto (The Grand Inquisitor). Production by John Dexter and featuring the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra conducted by James Levine and the Metropolitan Opera Chorus lead by chorus master David Stivender. Also included on this tape is a special short program “Verdi at San’t Agata” about Verdi’s beautiful villa which is now preserved just as he left it. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Covent Garden Video Productions and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Opera is arguably the best medium for dramatising history and this is particularly true for Verdi’s “Don Carlo” in Luchino Visconti’s magnificent and definitive 1958 production. Set in France and Spain in the second half of the 16th century, the five act opera tells of the political and amorous rivalry between Philip II of Spain and his son, Don Carlo. Bernard Haitink conducts The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House and a superb cast is led by Ileana Cotrubas as a tender and touching Elisabetta accompanied by the fine lyric tenor Luis Lima in the title role. Sung in Italian and English.

results.title: Don Breaks Out
results.brief_description: A profile of an enthusiast - a man whose fascination with the motion picture is equalled only by his fondness for creating instruments to make music. Maritimer Don Fletcher, ex-prison guard, now film projectionist, explains to an audience of university students how he came to make films, and also demonstrates how he built a violin unlike any other, which nevertheless pours out the real down-east country sound.
